page.title: 10Princess Square Bracknell
page.content: The site for{Princess Square}was planned in the early 50's when the shops for the new town were being planned. It was designed by London and Metropolitan Design Estates Ltd. and was built by Balfour Beaty. It took two years to build. It will stay the main attraction as it is the last stage of development. There are 37 shops, 2 shopping floors and 47 units, also there is one basement for storage. It cost nine million pounds to build the outside and twenty-five million pounds to fit the inside. It was opened in{June 1982.}It was supposed to be opened by{Princess {Diana}but she couldn't attend because she was pregnant,so{Princess Anne} opened it instead and it was named after her. The main shops in{Princess {Square }are Sainsbury's,Boots and W.H.Smith's.
